result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roger A Perschke in court.  Attorney Ralph J Sczygelski in court for Roger A Perschke.  Prosecuting attorney Jill L. Vendetti in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State moves to dismiss and read in this file as part of the plea agreement with 21CF407.  Motion granted.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Plea and sentencing held. Defendant taken into custody.
Defendant failed PBT.
Defendant brought back to court; plea/sentencing vacated.
Plea/Sentencing Hearing scheduled for 10/17/2022, at 3:30 p.m.
Minutes.
Letter from Jackie Nitschke Center confirming successful completion of the substance abuse treatment program.
Plea date on October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

8:33 am - Defendant Roger A. PERSCHKE in court.  Attorney Ralph J Sczygelski in court for Roger A. PERSCHKE.  Prosecuting attorney Jill L. Vendetti in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sczygelski has filed a request for adjournment which was received by the court yesterday.  The State objects to any adjournment.  Court comments and will grant one more adjournment in order to allow him to complete and graduate from the Jackie Nitschke Center.
Plea date scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Request for Adjournment.

9:38 AM Defendant Roger A Perschke appeared by video.  Attorney Ralph J Sczygelski appeared by video for Roger A Perschke.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.   Inducement made.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial. 
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information to be filed/has been filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Plea date scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea date on August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-04-22 at 9:30 a.m.   
Minutes.

2:23 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Roger A Perschke in court.  Defendant will be hiring counsel.  Initial appearance is reset to 07-25-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, on 06-17-22.
Order to report to TRPD for photo and prints

$150.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond.
--Chrissy Hamberg, 7626 St. Pats Road, Reedsville, WI  54230
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct, felony bail jumping and misdemeanor bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-27-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $150.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no assaultive contact with C.A.H.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the county jail.  
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
